title: IIT-Madras team wins an admirer in Elon Musk
summary: Student innovators from IIT-Madras impressed tech entrepreneur Elon Musk with their hyperloop pod design at the SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition 2019 in Los Angeles. The Avishkar Hyperloop team, incubated at IIT-M's Centre For Innovation, was the only Asian team among 21 selected from 1,600 global applicants. They aimed to build India's first self-propelled, autonomous Hyperloop Pod. During the event, the team interacted with Musk, founder-CEO of SpaceX, and Josh Geigel, co-founder of Virgin Hyperloop One. Although the competition was won by the Technical University of Munich, Avishkar Hyperloop's participation and Musk's admiration highlighted their innovative efforts.

title: Productivity tips from Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Steve Jobs
summary: Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, and Steve Jobs share productivity tips to maximize efficiency. Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, SpaceX, The Boring Company, and Neuralink, starts his day with critical tasks and prioritizes his schedule. He eliminates excessive meetings, believing they hinder productivity, and advises walking out of unproductive meetings. Jeff Bezos, Amazon's CEO, emphasizes making quick, high-quality decisions with about 70% of the needed information, valuing speed over perfection. Steve Jobs, the late Apple co-founder, focused on saying "no" to less critical ideas to maintain focus. Bill Gates incorporates meditation to improve concentration. Musk's key contributions include prioritizing essential tasks, reducing unnecessary meetings, and encouraging employees to leave non-valuable discussions.

title: Why Did Elon Musk Spend $218 Million on an Ultracapacitor Company?
summary: Tesla, led by Elon Musk, announced plans to acquire Maxwell Technologies for $218 million in an all-stock deal. Maxwell, a company specializing in ultracapacitors and storage materials, reported significant losses despite substantial revenues. The acquisition aims to leverage Maxwell’s ultracapacitor technology, known for its high-power density and rapid charging capabilities, and its innovative dry electrode technology. This technology promises to enhance battery costs, performance, and lifespan across various lithium-ion chemistries. Musk, who has long been interested in ultracapacitors, sees potential in Maxwell’s advancements to improve Tesla's energy storage solutions.

title: Here are Elon Musk’s wildest predictions about Tesla’s self-driving cars
summary: Elon Musk made several bold predictions about Tesla’s self-driving cars during an investor event at Tesla’s Palo Alto headquarters. He claimed that Tesla's vehicles will achieve full autonomy by the end of the year and that over a million robotaxis would be operational by 2020. Musk introduced a new high-performance microchip, touted as the best in the world, and mentioned ongoing work on an even more advanced chip. He also projected that Tesla cars would soon require minimal maintenance and last for a million miles. Musk criticized competitors' reliance on LIDAR technology, labeling it a "fool’s errand." Despite skepticism and criticism regarding the feasibility and safety of his claims, Musk emphasized that Tesla’s cars already have the necessary hardware for full self-driving capabilities, pending regulatory approval. He also discussed the Tesla Network, an Uber-like service for autonomous taxis, which could generate significant profits for Tesla owners.

title: Elon Musk wants to link brains directly to machines
summary: Elon Musk, renowned for his bold declarations, introduced a groundbreaking brain-machine interface (BMI) on July 16, 2019. This device, worn behind the ear, aims to facilitate direct communication between human brains and machines. Musk emphasized the necessity of human symbiosis with artificial intelligence (AI) to avoid being outpaced by technological advancements. His announcement highlighted his commitment to preventing humanity from being left behind in the AI revolution.

title: Elon Musk’s Plan to Save The World From Choking
summary: Elon Musk, the founder and CEO of SpaceX and Tesla, emphasizes that a college degree is not necessary to work at Tesla. He values "evidence of exceptional ability" over formal education credentials. Musk believes that individuals who have demonstrated remarkable achievements in the past are likely to continue doing so. He assesses potential employees based on their problem-solving skills and previous work experiences, asking detailed questions to ensure authenticity. Musk's stance is influenced by the success of notable college dropouts like Bill Gates and Steve Jobs. Despite his own education at the University of Pennsylvania, Musk prioritizes practical skills and innovative thinking in his hiring process.

title: "No Patent Suit Against People Who Use Our Tech In Good Faith": Elon Musk
summary: Elon Musk's Neuralink aims to merge the brain with AI using flexible "threads" implanted into the brain. Revealed at a San Francisco event, these threads, much thinner than a human hair, could allow control of smartphones or computers through thought. Neuralink has also developed a neurosurgical robot to implant these threads. While currently tested only in animals, Musk hopes to begin human trials by the end of next year, pending FDA approval. The technology is initially targeted to help paralyzed patients control devices with their minds. Musk's broader ambition is to achieve a symbiosis with AI, preventing humans from being left behind as AI advances.

title: Elon Musk unveils Neuralink’s plans for brain-reading ‘threads’ and a robot to insert them
summary: Elon Musk once paid nearly a million dollars for a 1976 Lotus Esprit, a car featured in the James Bond film "The Spy Who Loved Me." The car, which was bought for $100 from an unclaimed storage unit by an anonymous couple in 1989, was later restored and displayed at exhibits. In 2013, it was auctioned and purchased by Musk for $997,000. Musk, influenced by his childhood memories of watching James Bond movies, was inspired by the car's design for Tesla's Cybertruck. He expressed his disappointment that the car couldn't actually transform into a submarine and mentioned plans to upgrade it with a Tesla electric powertrain to make it transform for real.

title: Elon Musk's Management Advice Is So Brilliant That I Threw Away 37 Business Books
summary: Elon Musk’s company Neuralink has unveiled its brain-machine interface technology, featuring flexible "threads" that are less likely to damage the brain and can transfer higher volumes of data. These threads are thinner than human hair and are designed to be implanted using a specially developed robot. Musk highlighted that the main purpose of the presentation was to recruit talent for Neuralink. He envisions this technology enabling a symbiosis with artificial intelligence, addressing the bandwidth problem in human-machine interaction. The system aims to allow paralyzed individuals to control devices and may eventually be implanted in humans.

title: Elon Musk says the tech is 'mind-bogglingly stupid,' but hydrogen cars may yet threaten Tesla
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has strongly criticized hydrogen fuel cell vehicles, calling the technology "mind-bogglingly stupid" and asserting that "success is simply not possible." Despite Musk's dismissive stance, hydrogen fuel cell technology is gaining traction, with a 2017 survey of global auto executives predicting it will outperform battery-powered electric vehicles in the long term. California is investing over $2.5 billion in clean energy funds to boost hydrogen and battery vehicle sales, including $900 million for hydrogen stations. Companies like Toyota and Honda are expanding hydrogen infrastructure and vehicle offerings, with Toyota's Mirai and Honda's Clarity leading the market. Musk's criticism contrasts with the broader industry's view, which sees hydrogen fuel cells as a viable alternative to gasoline and a complement to battery electric vehicles.

title: Why Elon Musk Once Paid Nearly $1 Million For Car That Was Bought For $100
summary: Elon Musk revealed that the Cybertruck's window smashed during its launch due to an unseen crack caused by a sledgehammer impact. The vehicle's demonstration sequence was flawed; the sledgehammer hit should have followed the steel ball test. Despite the mishap, Tesla received over 200,000 orders for the Cybertruck. Musk shared footage of a successful pre-launch test to clarify the issue. The incident, which drew mixed reactions, garnered significant attention online, leading to speculation about its potential orchestration. Jessica Caldwell noted that Musk's human approach contributes to Tesla's passionate fan base.

title: Elon Musk Sees His Neuralink Merging Your Brain With A.I.
summary: Elon Musk and Jack Ma discussed the future of AI at the World AI Conference in Shanghai. Musk expressed concerns about AI's rapid advancement outpacing human understanding and emphasized the need for high-bandwidth brain interfaces, like Neuralink, to keep up with AI. He described humanity as a "biological boot loader" for AI, underscoring the existential risk of AI surpassing human intelligence. Musk also highlighted the importance of becoming a multi-planetary species to ensure the continuity of consciousness. In contrast, Ma was optimistic about AI, believing it will enhance human understanding and creativity, and stressed the importance of focusing on Earth’s sustainability.

title: Elon Musk: Humanity Is a Kind of 'Biological Boot Loader' for AI
summary: A California judge ruled that Tesla CEO Elon Musk and other executives illegally attempted to sabotage employee unionization efforts at their Fremont, California factory. The violations included harassment of workers distributing union pamphlets, banning pro-union attire, interrogating organizers, and firing one of them. Musk's tweets in May 2018, which included anti-union messages suggesting employees would lose stock options if they unionized, were also deemed illegal. The judge ordered Tesla to cease these practices, rehire the fired employee with back pay, and Musk must inform employees of their union rights. Despite these rulings, no financial penalties were imposed.

title: Elon Musk broke US labor laws on Twitter
summary: Elon Musk and Jack Ma presented contrasting views on AI's risks and benefits at the World AI Conference in Shanghai. Jack Ma expressed optimism, believing AI could enhance human understanding and create new job opportunities, reducing work hours. Conversely, Elon Musk warned about AI-induced mass unemployment and the potential end of human civilization, suggesting that humans may need to merge with AI to stay relevant. Musk emphasized the rapid technological evolution outpacing human comprehension and highlighted the risk of AI growing impatient with slower human communication. Both agreed on the looming issue of population collapse rather than overpopulation. Musk's contributions include founding and leading Tesla, SpaceX, The Boring Company, and co-founding OpenAI, although he has since distanced himself from the latter. He also advocates for brain-computer interfaces to keep pace with AI advancements.

title: Elon Musk and Jack Ma disagree about AI's threat
summary: Elon Musk, the billionaire CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, publicly supported Democratic presidential candidate Andrew Yang, who advocates for a universal basic income (UBI) of $1,000 a month for American citizens. Musk expressed his support via a tweet, stating, "I support Yang." Yang acknowledged Musk's support, emphasizing its significance. Both Musk and Yang share similar views on the necessity of UBI due to the rise of automation, which they believe will replace many jobs. Musk has previously discussed the likelihood of UBI becoming necessary, given technological advancements. His political engagements have been diverse, including past participation in President Trump's councils and donations to various political causes, though he identifies as a politically moderate independent.

title: Elon Musk backs presidential candidate Andrew Yang, who advocates giving Americans $1,000 a month
summary: Elon Musk's ambitious Starlink project aims to deploy around 12,000 satellites into low-Earth orbit to provide global internet coverage, particularly to remote areas. The initiative, led by Musk's company SpaceX, has already launched 60 satellites, sparking concerns about space junk, light pollution, and the impact on astronomical observations. Astronomers worry that the satellites, visible from Earth and potentially interfering with radio frequencies, could disrupt ground-based astronomy. Despite assurances from Musk about the satellites' minimal visibility and efforts to reduce their reflectivity, the scientific community remains apprehensive. Musk has acknowledged these concerns and directed his team to explore solutions for reducing the satellites' albedo.

title: Will Elon Musk’s Starlink satellites harm astronomy? Here’s what we know.
summary: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, is known for his eccentric use of Twitter. Recently, he faced backlash for sharing a web artist's work without giving credit, which angered many of his 27 million followers. Musk responded dismissively to calls for crediting the artist, tweeting "no" and "it's top secret," and later deleting these tweets. He argued that crediting artists on Twitter is unnecessary and damaging to the medium, a stance that further upset netizens. Following the controversy, Musk deleted his Twitter account and changed his username to Daddy DotCom, continuing to post humorous content.

title: Elon Musk's mom on raising successful kids: 'I didn't treat them like babies or scold them'
summary: Elon Musk, speaking at the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai, expressed concerns about the impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on the job market. He stated that AI would render many jobs "pointless," suggesting that individuals who can program AI software might be less affected. However, Musk warned that eventually, AI could write its own software. He recommended young people study engineering and focus on fields involving human interaction or creative arts, as these areas are less likely to be disrupted by AI. Despite the potential job displacement, Musk highlighted that businesses emphasizing human interaction would still thrive.

title: Elon Musk to Receive Stephen Hawking Communication Prize from Astrophysicist Brian May
summary: Elon Musk, the founder and CEO of SpaceX, has been awarded the 2019 Stephen Hawking Medal for Science Communication. This accolade recognizes Musk's significant contributions to space exploration and science communication. Musk's SpaceX has achieved milestones such as the successful flights of the Falcon Heavy rocket and the development of reusable rockets, which aim to reduce spaceflight costs and advance missions to Mars. The medal will be presented by astrophysicist Brian May, also known for being the guitarist for Queen, at the Starmus V science communications festival in Zurich. This award comes a year after the death of Stephen Hawking, the renowned scientist.

title: Elon Musk Promises a Really Truly Self-Driving Tesla in 2020
summary: Maye Musk shares her approach to raising successful children, emphasizing hard work and independence. She believes in putting kids to work at a young age and allowing them to follow their interests without treating them like babies or scolding them. As a single mother of three, she worked full-time to provide for her family and involved her children in her nutrition business. Elon Musk, her oldest child, is noted for making significant contributions by creating electric cars to save the environment and launching rockets. Kimbal started farm-to-table restaurants and teaches children to build gardens, while Tosca produces and directs films. Maye attributes their success to teaching them good manners, responsibility, and letting them make their own decisions. She encourages parents to allow their children to handle their own responsibilities and not to stress over them excessively.

title: Couple paid $100 for abandoned car they found in a storage unit—Elon Musk bought it from them for nearly $1 million
summary: In 1989, a couple from Long Island paid $100 for an unclaimed storage unit, discovering a 1976 Lotus Esprit sports car used in the 1977 James Bond film “The Spy Who Loved Me.” Initially unaware of its value, they later learned it was a famous Bond car. After restoring it, they exhibited the vehicle before auctioning it in 2013. Elon Musk, fascinated by the car since childhood, purchased it for nearly $1 million. Musk expressed plans to upgrade it with a Tesla electric powertrain to make it transform like in the movie, showcasing his continued interest in innovative technology.
